H0.text: Less sediment would be deposited along the shoreline if rivers that empty into the ocean were dammed, reducing beach formation.

H1.text: Beaches would form from different materials if rivers that empty into the ocean were dammed, as the damming changes the sediment supply that reaches the shoreline.

H2.text: Sand dunes would become smaller if rivers that empty into the ocean were dammed, because beach formation relies on sediment deposited along the shoreline.

H3.text: Deltas would become larger if rivers that empty into the ocean were dammed, because the dams would alter the sediment flow that normally contributes to beach formation along the shoreline.

A4.text: Sediment discharge into a reservoir formed by a dam forms a reservoir delta.
